Environment

Class ImageManipulation

  • java.lang.Object
    • Environment.ImageManipulation

  • public class ImageManipulation
extends java.lang.Object
    Static methods to manipulate the the size of ImageIcons
    Author:
    Benjamin Thurber, Blake Kayser

        Takes an ImageIcon and desired width and height and returns a scaled ImageIcon.
        Parameters:
        unscaledImageIcon - swing ImageIcon to be scaled
        width - int desired width
        height - int desired height
        Returns:

      • scaledImageIcon

        public static javax.swing.ImageIcon scaledImageIcon(javax.swing.ImageIcon unscaledImageIcon,
                                                    float percentSize)
        Takes an ImageIcon and desired percent scale factor and returns a scaled ImageIcon.
        Parameters:
        unscaledImageIcon - swing ImageIcon to be scaled
        percentSize - float of the amount to scale by
        Returns:
        a new swing ImageIcon scaled to the desired size

      • scaledImageIcon

        public static javax.swing.ImageIcon scaledImageIcon(javax.swing.ImageIcon unscaledImageIcon,
                                                    int sideLength,
                                                    boolean scaleByWidth)
        Takes an ImageIcon, desired side length and a boolean scaleByWidth. If true it fixes the sideLength to the width and scales the height proportionally. If false, fixes the sideLength to the height. Returns a scaled ImageIcon.
        Parameters:
        unscaledImageIcon - swing ImageIcon to be scaled
        sideLength - the length either width or height to scale to
        scaleByWidth - boolean. If true it fixes the sideLength to the width and scales the height proportionally. If false, fixes the sideLength to the height.
        Returns:
        a new swing ImageIcon scaled to the desired size
